definition: to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: The countdown to World Blood Donor Day (WBDD) has started.
sentences.chinese: 世界獻血日倒計時已經開始。

sentences.english: Thursday marks the 30-day countdown to the grand opening of the 2010 Shanghai World Expo.
sentences.chinese: 4月1日，上海世博會迎來開幕倒計時30天。

sentences.english: There are two count-down that number is in charge of showing the present red light at each crossing.
sentences.chinese: 每個路口有哦兩位數碼管顯示當前紅燈的倒計時。

sentences.english: We are near the mid-point in the countdown to 2015.
sentences.chinese: 我們現在已接近2015年倒計時的中點。

sentences.english: Make-or-break week for GM as deadline nears .
sentences.chinese: 破產還是重組，通用汽車一週大限倒計時。

sentences.english: In countdown the system uses when 8 LED show minutes and seconds.
sentences.chinese: 倒計時系統中採用8個LED顯示日時分秒。

sentences.english: Ok, here’s the countdown, in no particular order.
sentences.chinese: 好，現在開始倒計時，沒有什麼特別的順序。

sentences.english: Listeners on Earth heard the countdown from Tranquility Base.
sentences.chinese: 地球上的聽衆聽到靜海谷底倒計時的聲音。

sentences.english: So, 10 seconds on this, this should be fast.
sentences.chinese: 那麼，倒計時十秒鐘，這應該很快就能做完。

sentences.english: They are color bars, slate, countdown clock, black and silence.
sentences.chinese: 它們是彩條，剪輯板，倒計時和黑場。

sentences.english: As the countdown draws closer, have some quiet drinks back at your flat.
sentences.chinese: 在倒計時越來越近時，回到你的公寓來點飲料。

sentences.english: They will then take part in a dress-rehearsal countdown a few days later.
sentences.chinese: 幾天以後，他們將會進行一個倒計時彩排。

sentences.english: Our end-of-year countdown began at 8 o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 我們的新年倒計時在八點鐘開始。

sentences.english: OK, let's take 10 seconds on that.
sentences.chinese: 好，讓我們開始十秒倒計時。

sentences.english: You can use a timeline to create a personal countdown challenge.
sentences.chinese: 你可以做個時間表來給自己倒計時。

sentences.english: June 19 marks the 50-day countdown of the Beijing Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 6月19日是北京奧運會倒計時50天。

definition: to count backwards (from 10 down to 0)/to count down/from the bottom (lines on a page)/from the back (rows of seats)
on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
to keep up with/to catch up with/to overtake/to chance upon/in time for
anniversary of the founding of a school
see 光棍節|光棍节[Guang1 gun4 jie2]
opera (or role) involving much singing and action/(fig.) highlight/main feature/major activity
to fulfill one's dream/(divination) to predict the future by interpreting a dream/oneiromancy
